thag10.1:1.1: “The trees are now crimson, venerable sir,
thag10.1:1.2: they’ve shed their foliage, and are ready to fruit.
thag10.1:1.4: great hero, this season is full of flavor.
thag10.1:2.2: wafting their scent all around, in all directions.
thag10.1:2.3: They’ve shed their leaves and wish to fruit,
thag10.1:2.4: hero, it is time to depart from here.
thag10.1:3.1: It is neither too hot nor too cold,
thag10.1:3.2: venerable sir, it’s a pleasant season for traveling.
thag10.1:3.3: Let the Sākiyas and Koḷiyas see you,
thag10.1:3.4: heading west across the Rohiṇī river.
thag10.1:4.1: In hope, the field is plowed;
thag10.1:4.2: the seed is sown in hope;
thag10.1:4.3: in hope, merchants travel the seas,
thag10.1:4.5: The hope that I stand for:
thag10.1:5.1: Again and again, they sow the seed;
thag10.1:5.2: again and again, the lord god sends rain;
thag10.1:5.3: again and again, farmers plow the field;
thag10.1:5.4: again and again, grain is produced for the nation.
thag10.1:6.1: Again and again, the beggars wander,
thag10.1:6.2: again and again, the donors give.
thag10.1:6.3: Again and again, when the donors have given,
thag10.1:6.4: again and again, they take their place in heaven.
thag10.1:7.1: A hero of vast wisdom purifies seven generations
thag10.1:7.2: of the family in which they’re born.
thag10.1:7.3: Sakya, I believe you’re the king of kings,
thag10.1:7.4: since you fathered the one who is truly called a sage.
thag10.1:8.1: The father of the great hermit is named Suddhodana;
thag10.1:8.2: and the Buddha’s mother is named Māyā.
thag10.1:8.3: Having borne the Bodhisatta in her belly,
thag10.1:8.4: she rejoices in the heaven of the Thirty-Three.
thag10.1:9.1: When she died and passed away from here,
thag10.1:9.2: she was blessed with heavenly sensual pleasures;
thag10.1:9.3: enjoying the five kinds of sensual stimulation.
thag10.1:9.4: Gotamī is surrounded by those hosts of gods.”
thag10.1:10.1: “I’m the son of the Buddha, the incomparable Aṅgīrasa, the poised,
thag10.1:10.3: You, Sakya, are my father’s father;
thag10.1:10.4: Gotama, you are my grandfather in the Dhamma.”
